cyclone.name: IAN
cyclone.current_location: about 90 mi SW of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn north-northwest today, then north and north-northeast, tracking toward the west coast of Florida (Tampa Bay–Englewood area) by mid-week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west coast of Florida between Englewood and the Anclote River (near Tampa Bay)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Englewood to the Anclote River, including Tampa Bay
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect for port as of Advisory 13 (Storm Surge Watch exists but no warning yet)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire west coast of Florida from the Florida Keys northward through Tampa Bay and the Anclote River
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds possible by Tuesday night with hurricane conditions possible Wednesday; sustained winds could exceed 64 kt (74 mph).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Life-threatening inundation of 5–8 ft possible in Tampa Bay, including the Port Manatee shoreline.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–10 inches, locally up to 15 inches, likely causing considerable flooding in central-west Florida.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf/rip currents and a few tornadoes possible beginning late Tuesday.
